titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: in his room at the Palace of Westminster. He told me that he hoped to secure Biblical Instruction in all the schools at the option of the local authorities; that in the non–provided schools which were taken over, whether by lease or purchase, facilities for denominational teaching might be given: & possibly (though the teachers would probably resent this) over the whole area. He would be ready to make a special arrangement for the Roman, Jewish, & possibly also the Anglican schools in the towns.
